headline: Easy Homemade Chili
description: An easy homemade chili made with ground beef, onion, tomatoes, beans, and seasonings that cooks in just 20 minutes for a family-pleasing meal.

video.description: This homemade chili is hearty and meaty, and is very quick to make.
video.name: Easy Homemade Chili

name: Easy Homemade Chili

recipeInstructions.text: Place ground beef and onion in a large saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir until meat is browned and onion is tender, about 5 to 7 minutes.

Stir in tomato sauce, kidney beans, stewed tomatoes with juice, and water. Season with chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover and let simmer for 15 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Needed more chili powder in my opinion but otherwise a good start to some good chili
Wow. Where's the spices?? It tastes more like a bolognese sauce with some beans in it, but not even that good. Just saying!

This is a good Base for chili, then add other spices like most others did. And simmer in the crock pot to marry the flavors. I mix ground turkey ,1lb+ half pound each ground pork and chorizo. Chili or combine with kidney beans. I take out about a cup, straining off most of juice, and freeze in individual snack size bags to put on my hot dogs since I don't eat Red meat.

I put in 1/2 cup of chicken stock instead of the water. Added more chili powder and some sugar to cut the acidity. I used Rotel mild instead of stewed tomatoes. It will be a treat in this cold NE weather. I
This recipe makes bland soup. Leave out the water. Use a table spn chili powder and teaspoons of onion, garlic, salt, cumin. Then u have somthing.
Was very good, but added more chili powder and garlic powder
Very easy and not bad. Did add a bit more chili powder and garlic. Served with cornbread muffins and family liked it!
It was quick and easy. I did add in an extra cup on beans and I do recommend adding at least 2 tbsp of the chili powder and garlic powder for it to actually taste like chili
The ingredient list is about right, but "a pinch of chili powder"?? This wouldn't taste anything like chili with only a pinch of the main seasoning. Used about 3tbsp and it came out good.

I made this chilli for supper it was a cold and rain day The chilli was great. I added more chilli power and one can of chilli with beans and another another 1/2 cup water We like ours with more juice I will be making this again.

1st time making homemade chili so I wanted a simple recipe. Of course I added a few twists- I suggest using two cans of beans ( I used two of the kidney and pinto mix). I also used white and red onion (half of each). Substitute the water with beef broth and substitute the pinch of garlic powder with minced garlic. Of course don’t forget to add a teaspoon of cayenne pepper, diced bell pepper and a tablespoon of sugar. If you’re looking for the recipe for Wendy’s famous chili, follow my directions- THIS IS IT!

So many things wrong with this recipe. A pinch of chili powder? I made this exactly like the recipe. It was the blandest tasting chili I ever tasted. I had to adjust the seasoning to bring out the chili flavor.
2 cups of water, add more spices 10/10
Made two pounds of meat add my own spices

I don’t normally care for chili but made this for dinner. It was the best chili I have ever had or made. To put that into perspective I’m a happily retired 60 something so have been cooking for many years.
Thanks so much I added a pack of chili seasoning instead of adding what the recipe said and when I tell you the best
This time I added minced garlic and green bell pepper to give it the real Mexican twist. Great!!!
Easy to make. I had all the ingredients on hand.
Yummy, simple chili.

I’m giving it 4 stars because it gave me the base of making a homemade chili .. with that being said, as a cubana and Puerto Rican , we love flavor! So I added Sofrito, more garlic, peppers, more chilli pepper/ powder, cumin and instead of the water I used beef broth. I added Tomato paste as well to thicken everything. Soooooo delicious ..
The best tasting and easiest chili recipe I’ve made!

I had to "dress up" mine up a bit. I added about 1.5 T of chipotle in adobo sauce (cutting up the chipotle peppers (2), I added a few shakes of curry powder (I dislike cumin flavor, generally) subbed smoke paprika for the chili powder. Otherwise was this recipe and really a good basic recipe. TY!
Simple ingredients with awesome flavor. I only changed one thing and that is I used a dark lager beer instead of water. Pure comfort food!
I would rate it higher, but I had to make modifications to make it taste the way I wanted it to. The original recipe is too bland.

This was a really easy and delicious chili recipe. However I did make a few changes, I did not add any water…. And I added extra chili seasoning and extra beef, because I like my chili a little chunky.

I substituted a few items; but, the core items are basically the same. Didn't use beef, used turkey instead; and, instead of tomato sauce I used pasta sauce (cheese and garlic). But I think it turned out good.

Might just serve it on a bed of pasta.
SO delicious! Added corn and black beans, simmered for an extra 10 mins.

Definitely a quick and easy recipe for chili. I would suggest a lot more seasoning if you like a little more flavor. I added cumin and more chili powder for a little more spice. Chipotle seasoning would also be great in this.
It was just ok. The sauce was sweet. It taste more like a spaghetti sauce. My son did not like it.
I added some chopped garlic for extra flavor.
It turned out delicious!!

We all have the types of chili that are our favorites but I like to try new things all the time (especially ones listed as "easy!). As written, I did not care for this at all. First, the chili itself is too watery even after trying to cook it down, which negates the 15 minute simmer- this can easily be fixed by adding less water. The texture with the beans did not appeal to us because the beans are somewhat hard and we prefer softer ones (Campbell's Pork and Beans would be great). The most important aspect, of course, are the spices. This recipe says a "pinch" of chili powder and garlic powder- while I did notice on the direction line to season to taste, I shudder to think of all the new cooks who took the ingredient list literally and then couldn't figure out why it had no flavor. It would be far better if the larger amounts of spices required by chili were listed and then the cook could adjust them slightly in either direction as they made this. I didn't hate this recipe but it is one I won't repeat. Easy means not having to play and adjust everything in the recipe!
Left out the water. Nice and thick.
Too tart. Not enough chili seasoning. Next time I'll add more seasoning and simmer longer.
Just how I make mine
Awesome recipe! I added more garlic and didn’t use any water because it would have been way to soupy!
I wanted to try a different way from the way I make it and had to be quick about it and this one was it not a lot of stuff and less stuff then what I use but very good and it tasted good as well.

I love using this recipe as a base to make it my own style. It’s never the same. I like to add different vegetables to the list because it’s the easiest way to get the teen boys to eat them. Some items I use are Hot Mexican Chill Pepper, dice tomates and green chili (can), red bean with black beans, California style vegetable & bean blends (cans), and dice green chili (can); the combination changes with my mood. Today, I am trying a combination with celery and green onions added to the mix.

The recipe was good. I just upgraded on some ingredients like cilantro and instead of powder garlic , I put fresh garlic instead. I did not use water wanted the flavors of the herbs and juice broth from the meat to combine together with the rest of ingredients crush tomatoes,tomatoes sauce,pepper, salt etc

As others have said this is a good starter but the flavor was so very bland. As a result I added 4 cloves of garlic(minced and cooked with onion and meat), 2-3 tablespoons of chili, 1/2 of a jalapeño(chopped), cumin, salt and pepper to taste. Also added shredded cheddar and I omitted water. The cans of beans and tomatoes had enough liquid to keep it at a decent consistency. I served this up with cornbread and a salad.
Great! I didn't have the right beans, but pinto beans worked fine. It's a keeper

Giving a 3 because when following directions it does come out a little soup like. I also had to add more chili powder and garlic powder to make it more chili like. I will say that the left overs after putting the fridge and eating again the next day tasted better and was alot thicker than before. It's a good base for a chili and now just to tweak and expand on. I will add beans to this and a few other items to make it more my style
love it i actually this is my second time i did add some different things i also added a bell pepper as well as oregano and Italian seasoning also tomato paste to it
loved it...added red peppers and green peppers during saute, also added minced garlic...used tablespoon of chili powder...cant wait to eat!

Very easy to make.

.did exactly as the recipe called for....

Tasty and a make again satisfaction.
This was quick and easy to make. I didn't have stewed tomatoes so I used about 12 oz of spicy V-8.
Yummy easy fast
Outstanding and easy
I made this and it was amazing! The only thing id change would be instead of chopped onions I put chopped peppers.

I tripled the recipe so I would have leftovers. I added 3 chopped green peppers and 3 cloves minced garlic to ground beef (almost 3 lbs ground beef). I used three 15-Oz cans diced tomatoes instead of stewed, two 15 Oz cans Goya pink beans without the liquid) one 8 Oz can tomato sauce, one 8 Oz can tomato paste, no water. I also added more chili powder and some cayenne pepper. I prefer my chili a little on the spicy side. This was delicious served with cheddar cheese, a dollop of sour cream and Italian bread. I will definitely make this again

A pinch of chili powder does not make it chili. Add more chili powder (1 tbsp. or so) to the recipe, unless you want hamburger soup. After adding additional chili powder and using spicy beans instead of regular chili beans, it was delicious. Served it with corn chips and cheese and it was very good.
No changes,very good.
I doubled it. Used 2tbsp garlic powder, 2 fresh cloves of garlic, 2tbls brown sugar and 1/4 finally chopped bell pepper. Seasoned with salt at the end. My son and hubby went back for 2nds and 3rds.
I’m only 13 and this recipe was much easier than I thought. Highly recommend if your cooking for a small family. I added thyme bay leaves and some Hawaiian salt turned out good!

Hey someone 's been looking in my recipe cards! The only change to mine is more chili powder. Occasionally I will chop up a medium green bell pepper to add to the chili pot, and maybe chop a couple cloves of fresh garlic instead of the garlic powder. Still this is the simplest of my comfort food recipes.
I made it but substituted chili beans for kidney beans. I also used two cans of diced tomatoes instead of adding water. It is easy and so good. Just what one needs on a cold winter's night.
Very delisious
Very easy recipe. I did not add the water and I added 1/2 can tomato paste. Probably could omit the paste if leaving out water. Also used approx. 2 tablespoons of chili powder. Family loved it!!
It was absolutely delicious my son 13 is a picky eater and he had 2 servings. Along with small side of broccoli and potatoes.
I added diced tomatoes and green pepper and I didn’t add water
Yes I made changes to the chili! I added 1 1/2 tbsp chili powder and no water at all I like a thicker chili Very easy to make I would definitely make it again Thanks for sharing!!!
It was so delicious. Made it for my granddaughters while they were visiting me and they loved It. Yes!!! I made it again and will be making it again and again.

I used onion soup mix instead of a chopped onion.
And I added bbq sauce.

This was really simple to make and turned out better than I would have thought! I ended up buying the wrong chili powder, so I used garlic salt, onion powder, and cumin for flavor. It was definitely more than a pinch, I like food to be flavorful. Additionally, I swapped ground beef for ground turkey to be more health conscious.

Everything worked well except for the water — I'd skip that or significantly reduce it unless you like your chili very watery. Also, I'd probably add more chili and garlic powder depending on how you define "pinch."

Overall it was simple and easy to make however, I only used about 3/4 of a cup of water because I wanted it to be thicker and I used a whole lot more chili and garlic powder because it tasted too much like tomato sauce. I also added a pinch of cayenne because I like spicy chili. It’s delicious though!!
Great base recipe!!! I made a whole bunch of changes, but had no idea what I was doing. So this really helped me to learn the basics at least!!
Taste was great, but very watery. Next time I plan on taking out the water and possibly draining the stewed tomatoes as well.

I added green peppers, diced tomatoes with chilies and regular diced tomatoes, 2 teaspoons of tomato paste. I deleted cumin and beef broth not needed. It was great, and it was defiantly 6 servings. My son and husband loved it. Great comfort food. Will make again!
Its Just sooo GOOD#!
Easy to make & everyone loves it. I have made it several times
Followed every step of the recipe but it ended up tasting more like a tomato soup and really runny. Maybe I’ll try again but add more chili powder.
Added I can of tomato paste- next time I will drain the can of kidney beans. This was so easy and so delicious! I will definitely make it again
This is a great base for chili. Like many others, I added garlic, green pepper and other spices. Perfect for Sunday Football in the autumn :)
This was my first time making Chili, and the family loved it. I will be making this dish again. Very quick and easy to make.
this was very good. i doubled the recipe and only added 1 1/2 cup of water and the texture was great, especially with fritos, cheese, and sour cream. yummy!

So simple! This is going to be my "go to" chili recipe from now on. Basic chili - but very good. I prepped the night before and had my husband throw in the crockpot for a couple of hours before I got home from work.
My husband loved the chili. It was my first time making chili. I added cumin spice and this was scrumptious!

So the original recipe needs some adjustments but it's an amazing base, forgo the water if you like it thick. My additions Cummin, paprika, sazson seasoning, corn, fresh garlic. Toppings cilantro, cheese and sour cream.
I added pinto beans & didn’t use water & it still tasted amazing! I recommend it to anyone!!!
I made this for dinner with some homemade cheese bran bread and my boyfriend loved it.

Simple, easy, delicious. Spiced to taste.
Everyone loved it!
I added tomato paste to thicken up this recipe. Use more chili powder and cumin to leave more flavor.
I omitted the water and added red and yellow peppers and spiced it up more with chili powder, was fantastic! Thank you!!! great recipe
Followed the recipe exactly as written. It was quick easy and very tasty. In the future I may play around with the seasonings a bit. Great dinner choice for something tasty and quick after work.
I’m shocked at all the 5 star ratings on this recipe. Without adding a lot of extra chili powder and seasoning to this recipe it would taste like a tomato stew. Good base to work off of though.
I used beyond burger instead of ground beef and it was great. Thank you for sharing
It was okay as a base, but tasted very sweet in my opinion. I added A LOT of chili powder, some cayenne, cumin, and lime juice to cut the sweetness.
It turned out great.

I have made this chili for years. Honestly this recipe is a great starter. I recommend adding to it over time by reading comments below or making it with friends. Personally I add to above in the 2nd and 3rd step, can of black beans, can of pinto beans, jar of desired salsa (medium for me), can of corn, diced up green pepper, pinch of cumin, minced garlic instead of dry garlic, 1/2 or more can of tomato paste to thicken, and a pinch of cinnamon. Will make more servings than before. For extra fun and flavor, add tortilla chips (with a kick of lime) crushed up, cheese (cheddar, Mexican mix, etc. It’s cheese, how can you go wrong?), and a bit of sour cream.
Did not make any changes to it and definitely would make again
I added more pepper, chili powder and a hint more salt. Left out the water because I am also a fan of thicker chili - but overall great flavor great receipe!
Very easy to make. Family loved it! Used mostly organic! Very clean/natural taste!
Omg!!! This was a the bomb for our family on a cold and rainy day served with some cornbread..
I used chicken broth instead of water and tomato soup instead of tomato sauce and added garlic powder, salt and pepper and 1/2 package of taco seasoning instead of chili powder
One pinch of chili powder does not make chili. This is hamburger/bean soup with tomatoes. On the plus side, it certainly is easy.
Made it and it came out good

I think this is a great starter chili recipe that you can customize. I used the following substitutes - quorn meat (don't use if allergic to eggs), pink beans, 2 cloves of garlic and 1 cup of water. I added cumin and used the remaining items on the ingredients list. I wish I had cooked the onions by themselves as I prefer a softer onion.
Love this chili. Super fast and easy. I like my chili a little more spice so added chipotle chili spice. Yum!
